DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine efficacy 12-week mindfulness-based yoga intervention depressive symptom rumination among depressed woman .
DOC.brief_title: Mindfulness-Based Yoga Intervention Women With Depression
DOC.detailed_description: This study prospective , randomize control intervention pilot study conduct metropolitan city upper Midwest United States . Forty woman meet criterion depression base Structured Clinical Interview Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders IV ( SCID-I ; First , Spitzer , Gibbon , & Williams , 1997 ) randomize experimental mindfulness-based yoga condition ( n=20 ) walk control condition ( n=20 ) . Both program home-based motivational session deliver telephone last 12 week . Assessments conduct baseline , three month ( i.e. , post-intervention ) , one-month follow-up ( i.e. , one month intervention end ) . Participants instruct continue usual depression care . The primary dependent variable depressive symptom base Beck Depression Inventory ( BDI ) . The secondary dependent variable rumination score Ruminative Responses Scale ( RRS ) . This protocol approve University Minnesota 's Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) . Participants complete informed consent form send mail ; consent participate physical activity also obtain participant 's healthcare provider . Recruitment trial occur February , 2013 January , 2014 follow-up assessment complete May , 2014 .
